intro: Uragoga thorbeckei, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a rare and striking plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, white, fragrant flowers that open at night. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, round seeds. Uragoga thorbeckei is known for its unique blooming pattern and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
